page.title: 06ROSE GREEN INFANTS' SCHOOL
page.content:
This school is fifteen years old and thirteen years ago an extension was built. The headteacher, Mrs. Haig, told us that there are seven teachers and 191 children. On the day we visited the school, two classes were out visiting Amberley Chalk Pits Museum.
The school has two colour televisions, a video and a B.B.C. 'B' computer. We saw a room with six sets of headphones where the children can listen to stories. They had pets, toilets and libraries in every class and a largish hall. We went outside and found a big field and playground. A pupil in the top year told us that they do mathematics, English, reading, P.E., music, drawing, sewing and painting. We thought the school had a happy and bright atmosphere.
